instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no display
threads.message:
Water damaged. Ok on external display but blank screen on internal lcd also on test lcd.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0V. Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no display
threads.message:
Any liquid sign on LCD connector?
CPU eDP output has no protection at all, directly connected to J8500.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no display
threads.message: There is a pin burnt in lcd connector on lcd side and on connector cable. Replaced it and tried with test lcd but it's like it is not recognised. I'm thinking to lift <CHIP>U8510</CHIP> and measure  <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>. I can't se other ways to do it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no display
threads.message:
"There is a pin burnt in lcd connector"
Which pin corresponds in schematic?

You can still arm a big iMac using a 42" TV...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no display
threads.message: Just measured the LVDS cable connector. It is pin 1 (<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL>).There is only 80ohm between pin 1 and the next pin 43 (<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no display
threads.message:
Classic overvoltage from backlight output.
If you cannot change CPU, think about mentioned iMac option...
